action.action-desc: Mr. Johnson of Georgia (for himself, Ms. Norton, Ms. Crockett, Ms. Clarke of New York, Mrs. Foushee, Mr. Doggett, Ms. Ross, Ms. Tlaib, Ms. Ocasio-Cortez, and Ms. Dean of Pennsylvania) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend chapter 16 of title 28, United States Code with respect to the effect of a vacancy of office on complaints against judges.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Transparency and Responsibility in Upholding Standards in the Judiciary Act or the TRUST Act.

section.header: Effect of a vacancy of office on complaints against judges

subsection.header: Review of complaints by chief judge
subsection.text: Section 352 of title 28, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:
The resignation, retirement from office under chapter 17, or death of a judge who is the subject of a complaint under section 351 shall not be grounds for—

paragraph.text: dismissing the complaint under subsection (b)(1); or
concluding that action on the complaint is no longer necessary under subsection (b)(2).

subsection.text: Section 353(c) of title 28, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking Each committee and inserting the following:
by adding at the end the following:

Each committee appointed under subsection (a) shall complete the investigation and file a report under paragraph (1) without regard to the resignation, retirement from office under chapter 17, or death of the judge whose conduct is the subject of the complaint.
